intro: Carpodinus leptantha, commonly known as the slender-leafed balsam, is a herbaceous plant native to tropical regions of Africa. It belongs to the family Acanthaceae and is characterized by its opposite, narrow, lance-shaped leaves. The plant produces clusters of small, tubular flowers that are typically pink or purple in color. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in forest understories or along stream banks. Due to its ornamental value, it is occasionally cultivated in botanical gardens and as a houseplant.
